abstracts.cdata!:
The Coastal Embankment Rehabilitation
            Project aims at restoring the security of agricultural
            crops, and homesteads, against flood, and salinity, and, at
            preserving human, and livestock populations in the project
            area, while maintaining a balance in the environment, and
            ecology at large. However, rehabilitation and improvement
            works, i.e., replacement, and re-sectioning of embankments,
            and polders, erosion as a result of works, and repairs of
            associated drainage structures, in addition to
            deforestation, will impact project affected people (PAP).
            Following completion of the socioeconomic survey (SES), the
            resettlement action plan (RAP) stipulates compensation due
            to land, household, and income losses resulting from
            implementation of the project. Compensation includes: land
            for land replacement, or cash/cheque compensation, estimated
            at replacement values, based on the SES findings. Crop
            losses will be compensated on standing crops at time of
            handover. Household, and structures will be replaced at
            comparable value, based on the SES estimates. Business, and
            income losses will be based on a ninety day transition
            period, and, displaced persons will be assisted with the
            move during the transition to resettlement sites, in an
            effort to improve, or at least restore their former living
            standards. Grievance mechanisms will ensure transparency
            during resettlement.
